contentrichtext.text: {{notability|date=September 2011}} {{primary sources|date=September 2011}} {{Infobox file format | name = Advanced Stream Redirector | extension = <tt>.asx</tt> | mime = <tt>video/x-ms-asf</tt> | owner = [[Microsoft]] | creatorcode = | genre = | container for = | contained by = | extended from = | extended to = }} The '''Advanced Stream Redirector''' ('''ASX''') format is a type of [[XML]] metafile designed to store a [[playlist]] of [[Windows Media]] files for a [[multimedia]] [[presentation]]. It is used frequently on streaming video servers where multiple ''[[Advanced Systems Format|ASF]]'' files are to be played in succession. Both [[RTSP]] and [[Microsoft Media Services|MMS]] streaming protocols are supported, as well as [[HTTP]]. ASX files have [[MIME]] type <code>video/x-ms-asf</code> (as do [[Advanced Systems Format|ASF]] files). With the introduction of the <tt>WMA</tt> and <tt>WMV</tt> container formats in late 1990s, <tt>WAX</tt> and <tt>WVX</tt> extensions have also been introduced by Microsoft respectively. ==Example== <source lang="xml"> <asx version="3.0"> <title>Example.com Live Stream</title> <entry> <title>Short Announcement to Play Before Main Stream</title> <ref href="http://example.com/announcement.wma" /> <param name="aParameterName" value="aParameterValue" /> </entry> <entry> <title>Example radio</title> <ref href="http://example.com:8080" /> <author>Example.com</author> <copyright>Â©2005 Example.com</copyright> </entry> </asx> </source> ==See also== * [[Windows Media]] * [[M3U]] * [[PLS (file format)|PLS]] * [[XSPF]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd562372(VS.85).aspx MSDN Simple ASX] * [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd564668(VS.85).aspx MSDN ASX Elements Reference] * [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms983653.aspx MSDN Adding Windows Media to Web Pages (For Webmasters)] * [http://www.microsoft.com/windows/windowsmedia/howto/articles/CustomizedExp.aspx Creating Customized Web Experiences with Windows Media Player 9 Series] [[Category:Microsoft Windows multimedia technology]] [[Category:Playlist file formats]] [[Category:Film and video technology]] [[Category:Playlist markup languages]] {{film-tech-stub}} {{markup-languages-stub}} {{multimedia-software-stub}}
